title: Executive Order 8328-Exemption of Henry Clarke Hill From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that Henry Clarke Hill, Warden of the United States Penitentiary, Lewisburg, Pennsylvania, who was exempted from compulsory retirement for age for a period not in excess of one year from March 1, 1939, by Executive Order No. 8041 of January 25, 1939, be further exempted from compulsory retirement for a period not in excess of six months from March 1, 1940:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), I hereby further exempt the said Henry Clarke Hill from compulsory retirement for age for a period not in excess of six months from March 1, 1940.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8328-Exemption of Henry Clarke Hill From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/210185
